intro: Cyrtandra × infraglabra, commonly known as the hybrid white heliotrope, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a natural hybrid between Cyrtandra pedata and Cyrtandra frondosa, characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with lance-shaped leaves and a tendency to form clumps. It is native to tropical regions of the Pacific and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
